raw_text:
Stuart joins Norwich from Addicks
 
 Norwich have signed Charlton midfielder Graham Stuart until the end of the season for an undisclosed fee.
 
 "It was a very easy decision to make," the 34-year-old told Norwich's website. "The attraction for me was to continue to play in the Premiership." Canaries boss Nigel Worthington added: "I'm delighted that Graham will be joining us until the end of the season. "He's gives us a wealth of experience. Hopefully, he can be part of keeping us in the Premier League." Stuart has extensive top-flight experience with Everton, Chelsea and Charlton and can play across the midfield positions. He joins Norwich with the Norfolk club second-from-bottom in the Premiership, but Stuart is confident that the Carrow Road outfit have a bright future. "I've been very impressed with the facilities here. It's obviously a very well run football club with excellent facilities and I've always enjoyed playing at Carrow Road," he added. "It's a nice compact ground with a good atmosphere and hopefully I can help give the fans something else to cheer."
 
 Stuart, a former England Under-21 international, made 110 appearances for Chelsea, scoring 18 goals, before joining Everton. He won the FA Cup with the Toffees in 1995 and remains a hero at Goodison Park after his 81st-minute winner against Wimbledon saved Everton from relegation in 1994. Stuart spent just over four years at Goodison Park, making 125 senior appearances and scoring 25 goals, before signing for Sheffield United - where he scored 12 goals in 68 appearances. After signing for Charlton he made 164 appearances, scoring 23 times, but recently he has been battling a back problem and had not played for the Londoners for three months before heading to Norwich.
llama3.2:1b: Stuart joins Norwich from Addicks on an undisclosed fee until the end of the season, after playing top-flight games with Chelsea and Charlton. He is expected to provide experience in the Premier League and hopes to contribute to Canaries' chances of staying in the league. Stuart has extensive experience playing for Everton, Chelsea, and Charlton, including a record-breaking 81st-minute winner against Wimbledon.
llama3.2:3b: Norwich have signed Charlton midfielder Graham Stuart until the end of the season from an undisclosed fee. Stuart joins Norwich with extensive top-flight experience playing across midfield positions for Everton, Chelsea, and Charlton.
gemma2:2b: Graham Stuart joins Norwich until the end of the season.  He brings Premier League experience and is confident in Norwich's future.  The move was made after Stuart expressed his preference to continue playing in the top division and Norwich sought his expertise.
qwen2.5:0.5b:
Here's a summary of the key points:

Norwich has signed former Charlton midfielder Graham Stuart for an undisclosed fee until the end of the season. Stuart, who previously played for Everton, Chelsea, and Charlton, brings experience in midfield across the top flight with 110 appearances.

Stuart joins Norwich as they are second from bottom in the Premiership after losing their top-flight position at the end of the season last year.
Gordon Worthington, the Canaries boss, expressed excitement for Stuart's addition to help keep Norwich in the Premier League.
Stuart, who made 196 senior appearances and scored 23 goals, has spent nearly four years at Goodison Park. He was a key player at Sheffield United before joining Charlton.

Stuart has played his home matches for Norfolk club Carrow Road since then, but is currently focused on Norwich.

Stuart, who previously played for Chelsea, Everton, and Charlton, adds experience to Norwich's squad and is excited about returning to Carrow Road. He joined with second-from-bottom in the Premier League but believes Norwich has a bright future there.

Stuart, a 34-year-old with Premiership experience from clubs including Everton, Chelsea, and Charlton, joined Norwich, currently bottom in the Premier League, eager for their potential improvement. He highlighted positive aspects at Carrow Road, such as good facilities and atmosphere. Stuart is an England Under-21 international who scored during Everton's FA Cup victory in 1995 and has played over 300 matches throughout his career.

"I've been very impressed with the facilities here," he added, noting that it's obviously a well-run football club with excellent facilities. "It's a nice compact ground with a good atmosphere." He has extensive top-flight experience and is confident about his future at Goodison Park.

Then he moved to Everton with the Toffees winning the FA Cup and staying in Manchester United after relegation issues. Now he's joining Norwich, which is his first transfer since Addicks.

So, I need to capture Stuart's key points: he's from Addicks, joining Norwich for an undetermined fee as a midfielder. Maybe mention his transition or specific details about Everton's recent performance.

Stuart, a former England Under-21 international with extensive Premier League experience, joins Norwich from Addicks as a midfielder. He had 110 appearances for Chelsea and scored 18 goals there before moving to Everton, winning the FA Cup in 1995 and staying in Manchester United after relegation issues. Stuart transitioned to Goodison Park after joining Everton with 125 senior appearances and 25 goals. Now, he's transferring to Norwich after completing his current role at Charlton, aiming for a bright future with a well-run club.
tinyllama:1.1b: Norwich have signed Charlton midfielder Graham Stuart as they look to boost their Premier League status with the signing of an experienced player who has experience playing across different positions. Stuart, aged 34, joins Norwich on a season-long loan from Championship side Charlton, where he had been on loan for three months before joining. The former Everton, Chelsea and Sheffield United midfielder has extensive top-level experience having played for Everton, Chelsea, Charlton, and Sheffield United, and scored 12 goals in 68 appearances while also making 125 senior appearances for Everton. His arrival at Carrow Road will give Norwich a new dimension to their midfield, with the addition of experience at the heart of their attack.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Stuart, a midfielder with extensive experience in the Premier League, has joined Norwich City on an undisclosed fee as the second-from-bottom team in the league. He is expected to contribute greatly to their midfield and bring fans hope for a bright future at Carrow Road. As a former England Under-21 international, Stuart has scored 18 goals while playing for Chelsea, Everton, and Charlton. A highly respected player with experience in both attacking and defensive roles, he is confident about his ability to contribute positively to the team. Moreover, he has a wealth of experience in top-flight football, having played at Everton, Chelsea, and Charlton. With Norwich City, Stuart will look to inspire the fans with his talent and skill on the field, hoping that they can keep their place in the Premier League despite being second-from-bottom.
